utils package

Submodules

utils.utils module

class utils.utils.Media(media_id, opinion=0.0)

Bases: object

get_id()

Returns the unique identifier of the media.

Returns:

The unique identifier of the media node.

Return type:

int or str

get_opinion()

Returns the opinion of the media.

Returns:

The opinion of the media.

Return type:

float

set_opinion(opinion)

Sets the media’s opinion.

Parameters:

opinion (float) – The new opinion of the media, which should be between -1 and 1.

Raises:

ValueError – If the opinion is not within the range [-1, 1].

class utils.utils.Voter(i, j, opinion=0)

Bases: object

add_media_connection(media_id)

Connects the voter to a media node by adding the media_id to the media_connections list.

Parameters:

media_id (int or str) – A unique identifier for the media node.

add_neighbor(neighbor_i, neighbor_j)

Adds a neighbor’s coordinates to the list of neighbors.

Parameters:

  • neighbor_i (int) – The row coordinate of the neighbor.

  • neighbor_j (int) – The column coordinate of the neighbor.

get_media_connections()

Returns the list of connected media node IDs.

Returns:

A list of media node IDs to which the voter is connected.

Return type:

list

get_neighbors()

Returns the list of neighbors’ coordinates.

Returns:

A list of tuples representing the coordinates of neighboring voters.

Return type:

list of tuple

get_number_of_neighbors()

Returns the number of neighbors.

Returns:

The number of neighboring voters.

Return type:

int

get_opinion()

Returns the opinion.

Returns:

The opinion of the voters.

Return type:

int

remove_media_connection(media_id)

Removes a media connection by removing the media_id from the media_connections list.

Parameters:

media_id (int or str) – The unique identifier of the media node to disconnect.

Raises:

ValueError – If the media_id is not found in the media_connections list.

set_opinion(opinion)

Sets the voter’s opinion.

Parameters:

opinion (int) – The new opinion of the voter, which should be -1, 0, or 1.

Raises:

ValueError – If the opinion is not -1, 0, or 1.

Module contents

utils.measure module

utils.measure.clustering(network)

Return the clustering (degree of agreement between neighbours)

utils.measure.deg_distribution(network)

Fit the degree distribution of the network to a power law and plot the results. Returns the exponent of the power law fit.

utils.measure.local_clustering(voter, network)

Returns the local clustering (i.e. the fraction of agreement between one voter and its neighbors)

utils.measure.neighbor_opinion(voter, network)

Return the average opinion of the neighbors of the voter

utils.measure.neighbor_opinion_distribution(network, name='neighbor_distribution')

Displays the distribution of the average opinion of neighbors depending on the opinon of the voter. Returns the the mean and standard deviation for each catagory.

utils.measure.number_media_distribution(network)

Displays the distribution of media connections of each voter. Returns the average and standard deviation.

utils.measure.opinion_share(network)

Returns the share of opinion of the entire network.

utils.measure.opinion_trend(df)

plots the opinion share in op_trend

utils.measure.polarization(network)

Returns the average opinion of the network.

utils.measure.power_law(x, a, b)

Fit function for degree distribution. For y scale free network 2 < b < 3.

Module contents

utils.visualization module

utils.visualization.test_visualize_matrix()

Test function for visualize_matrix. Generates a sample matrix with structured regions, visualizes it, and checks if the image is saved. Each run generates a different filename to prevent overwriting.

utils.visualization.visualize_matrix(matrix, output_folder, filename=None)

Visualizes a matrix with values -1 (red), 0 (grey), 1 (blue) and saves it as an image.

Parameters: - matrix: 2D numpy array with values -1, 0, 1. - output_folder: str, path to the folder where the image will be saved. - filename: str, name of the output image file. If None, a unique filename is generated.

Returns: - None
